data.title: Generalize the QuadBatch system to accept any triangle mesh
data.body:
I don't see a technical reason for why quad batches have to be limited to quads, as long as the data has the same vertex attributes, any mesh should work fine.

This should hopefully reduce the need for custom display objects to break batching.

data.title: Skip the rendertexture for filters when possible
data.body:
Allow filters to use actual textures, cutting out the middleman render texture, when possible.

That is, the object has to be using a texture that isn't subtextured and the object has to be a single Image.

data.title: Bug: The mNextTween property is not clear on reset()
data.body:
Hello Daniel,

I just stumbled upon a bug while using tween pooling.
The reset() method of Tween does not resetted the mNextTween property, it can cause problems from time to time.

Thanks again for the Framework!

Seb

data.title: Data store on starling.display.DisplayObject for referencing custom wrapper classes when using composition vs inheritance
data.body: It would be useful for the sake of composition to have a data field on `DisplayObject`, similar to Box2D's `b2Body` class. What I am trying to is have my own graphics classes that wrap Starling display classes, however I need to have a reference to my wrapper classes via the Starling objects to determine the correct values for `.parent` etc.

data.title: DisplacementMapFilter texture size and the view port
data.body:
hello,

i think there might be a small problem with the DMF class.

say we have a simple Main / Game test project:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/1627980/starling/test_dmf0.zip

it consists of Main that has a resize handler, and each time the app resizes, it resizes the viewPort to fit the native stage, while the Starling stage remains at 400x300px.

it also updates the root class (Game).
the Game class display lists only has an Image (test.png - 400x300px) that has a DisplacementMapFilter (map.png - 400x300px).

when the native stage resizes the base image resizes fine, but the DMF texture remains at the same size as the .PNG size (native size).

looking at DisplacementMapFilter.as this happens because activate() calls updateParameters() with the native texture size.

two questions:

1) 
if i change it to the following it works but i'm not sure it's desired:
updateParameters(texture.width, texture.height);

can that be considered as a bug and would the change break other logic?

2) 
now, the bigger issue arises - how do we auto-resize the DMF texture, without forcing the user to manually re-create the DMF on each resize.

if i apply the change in 1) and remove the Game(_starling.root).update(); call in Main, i can see the DMF texture starts resizing based on mip map levels, but it never fits the stage (on demand) the same way as the base image (test.png) does.

any ideas how to solve that?

data.title: Change the default value of Starling.handleLostContext to true
data.body:
It seems to me that handling lost context automatically is a better default today. It's much more common to enable this behavior than to keep it disabled, so let's save everyone a little bit of time and switch to a more reasonable default. As we've discovered, lost contexts are more common than originally expected on iOS, so usually, handleLostContext should be enabled there too. I assume that the main reason it was false before was because it required a lot of resources to keep BitmapData in memory. However, with the ability to restore textures with onRestore, there doesn't need to be any memory impact. AssetManager and Texture.fromEmbeddedAsset() set up onRestore automatically.

It might make sense to wait until a major version update. However, I feel like this change would be pretty safe if it happened sooner. The vast majority of developers are probably explicitly setting handleLostContext to true in their apps already, or they might still be making an exception for iOS. Regardless, the behavior will not change in these existing apps because the handleLostContext property is being set explicitly, overriding the default behavior. I suspect that the minority who wants handleLostContext to be false shouldn't require too much extra effort to support. If they're handling lost context manually, they'll probably be advanced enough to figure it out on their own pretty quickly. I imagine that this change would be very prominent in the announcement of a new version, so most people would see it before they upgraded. The solution for these developers is pretty obvious: add one line of code that sets handleLostContext to false.

data.title: TextField isHtmlText not work when autoScale is true
Performance Issue of onKey

milestone.title: Starling 2.0
milestone.description: This release will come with a much more flexible rendering architecture and some other changes I've been wishing to make for a long time. It won't be compatible with the old releases, though: several APIs will change.

data.body:
I am doing some performance test for my game on Scout, and find that when holding a key (say pressing 's' for 5 seconds), Starling.onKey becomes the most expensive procedure.

The reason behind is the game is a Platformer and have quite a large display hierarchy, and Starling.onKey is forced to loop everything single container inside Starling, even those container that is outside player's screen (sprite.visible = false).

Doing some research on internet, I figured out some people also have the similar problem.

http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/keyboard-lag
http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/keyboard-issue

I think the solution is keep a static protected const _onKeyList.Vector.<DisplayObject> in DisplayObject class.

When an displayobject calling addEventListener(keyEvent), the displayobject would add the object to the list (or remove if it is removeEventListener).

Now, Starling.onKey can now just loop through the list, instead of looping through the entire hierarchy.

data.title: Request: Make Button.onTouch protected
data.body: I would like to extend Button so I can easily add tooltips to my game buttons. If onTouch was protected, we could easily catch ButtonState.OVER in a derived class.

data.title: AssetManager. Forced adding xml
data.body:
Hello.
After after adding xml path by **assetManaget.enqueue("myxml.xml")** and loading start AssetManager automaticly detects type by first node name ("font" or "TextureAtlas") and searches for texture file.
What if I want to add that xml not as Texture or TextureAtlas but as xml.
For example I have font texture in main atlas and want to add only xml to AssetManager and pick up texture from atlas:
**new BitmapFont(assetManaget.getTextureAtlas("myAtlas").getTexture("myFontTexture"), assetManaget.getXML("myFontXML"));**

Is it posible now? If no, can I hope for appearance of this possibility?

data.title: Use the Event.RENDER event to interact with the flash frame skipping.
data.body:
The Flash player automatically skips rendering frames when it is too far behind. Starling does not, instead it tells all parts about how long it is since the last update.

Starling should obviously continue with the "how long since last update" feature, if only for compatibility reasons.

But starling should not be rendering frames when it is way behind. I recommend listening for the Event.RENDER event to let the Flash player itself decide when to render new frames.

data.title: Sprite3D rotation around object's center
data.body:
Hello again,

Today I was experimenting with Sprite3D, I am adding it into a Citrus StarlingState and then I center it to the stage:

```
sprite3d.x = (stage.stageWidth - sprite3d.width)*0.5;
sprite3d.y = (stage.stageHeight - sprite3d.height)*0.5;
```

![screen shot 2014-12-04 at 16 36 34](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3072785/5299903/f7bdd40e-7bd3-11e4-8b21-b8b397b0b44e.png)
![screen shot 2014-12-04 at 16 37 16](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3072785/5299908/fe98abe6-7bd3-11e4-8531-1b06467f1090.png)

Then I am trying to rotate the sprite3d but as I can see the pivot point of the rotation is on the top left (0,0); When I move the pivot point using the following:

```
sprite3d.alignPivot("center", "center");
```

![screen shot 2014-12-04 at 16 37 38](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3072785/5299913/09cedc6a-7bd4-11e4-8ad6-fc26cb9c15f7.png)
![screen shot 2014-12-04 at 16 37 57](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3072785/5299915/0ef5b6e6-7bd4-11e4-9f1f-ac4780223f07.png)

I can see that the pivot point centers on the sprite3d object but the sprite3d objects moves away for the center of the StarlingState (moves a bit up and left)! Same happens when I center the pivot points using pivotX and pivotY properties.

Any ideas? Actually you can add the difference to the x and y and then have it center again but shouldn't there be an easier way to rorate around center?

data.title: Easy optimizations (and one less easy)
data.body:
Hello Daniel,

According to my profiling:

In EventDispatcher you have 2 Vector.push(something) that should be rewritten as vector[vector.length] = something.

Also, I noticed that the regexp exec() getExtensionForURL in assetmanager is quite costy (but I dont know how to optimize it from the top of my head).

Have a nice day.

data.title: ColorMatrixFilter slows the FPS down on certain Android devices
Starling falls asleep with Distriqt NativeMaps ANE
DisplayObjectContainer::dispose()
data.body:
hello, i'm relatively new to the framework, but i think i've noticed a potential issue.
(not sure if repost)

dispose() in AS3 is considered a replacement for the lack of destructors in the language / VM and to manage important aspects such as memory de-allocation.
on the other hand, one of the goals of the "display list" design pattern is to easily assign children to parent object white maintaining the instances and hierarchy (.parent, getChildAt()..etc).

my question is, why does DisplayObjectContainer automatically de-allocates (calls dispose() to) all it's children?
a problematic scenario would be, where the framework user likes to have a couple of containers, where one of the container contains a child.
the user then decides to remove the first container (visually and from memory) and move the object to the second container.

by calling dispose() on the first container dispose() will also be called on the child element.
a solution is to first use firstContainer.removeChild(...) (where "dispose" is set to false as the default argument) and then secondContainer.addChild(...)

ideally DisplayObjectContainer::dipose(), should dispose of the children only optionally, but if this change is added at this point it will break compatibility and probably create mem-leaks in the user code.

data.title: SystemUtil.isDesktop can cause Invalid BitmapData
data.body:
This is right and also wrong when run mobile project on desktop simulator via windows
![isdesktop](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/97060/5120334/56a7cfd2-70b3-11e4-926e-fbe89f4db913.png)

and refer to
https://github.com/Gamua/Starling-Framework/blob/master/starling%2Fsrc%2Fstarling%2Futils%2FAssetManager.as#L1039

```
                // On mobile, it is not allowed / endorsed to make stage3D calls while the app
                // is in the background. Thus, we pause queue processing if that's the case.

                if (SystemUtil.isDesktop)
                    onComplete(asset);
                else
                    SystemUtil.executeWhenApplicationIsActive(onComplete, asset);
```

it will always use executeWhenApplicationIsActive because it think we're run on mobile.
This should be fine until we lost AIR window focus and get back focus later.
it will cause...

```
ArgumentError: Error #2015: Invalid BitmapData.
    at flash.display3D.textures::RectangleTexture/uploadFromBitmapData()
    at Function/http://adobe.com/AS3/2006/builtin::apply()
    at starling.utils::SystemUtil$/onActivate()[D:\libs-src\starling-v1.5.1\src\starling\utils\SystemUtil.as:64]
```

so this happen only when testing AIR mobile project on desktop then switch window.

I think we should use Capabilities.version with Capabilities.playerType and Capabilities.os all together 
for judging SystemUtil.isDesktop is really desktop.

Cheers

data.title: ColorMatrixFilter clipping SubTexture with frame
data.body:
When applying a ColorMatrixFilter to an Image with a SubTexture which has frame, it is drown clipped. This doesn't happen If the frame is the same as the region. I assume the filter is not taking the right bounds or something similar.

Using SubTextures with a frame is a common scenario since I'm using texture atlases with cropped textures.

I tried with another filter (BlurFilter) and the clipping doesn't happen.

Maybe is unrelated but, calling getBounds on an Image (stage space) with different frame positions for its SubTexture result in the same rect. Is this the expected behaviour?

data.title: starling ios, press power button issue
data.body:
i made a ios app using starling, when user press power button, trigger the following code to snap the starling stage:

``` as3
var result:BitmapData = new BitmapData(rect.width * scaleFactor, rect.height * scaleFactor, true, 0x00000000);
Starling.context.clear()
Starling.context.drawToBitmapData(result);
```

but i get the entire stage snapshot in result.
why is that, and how could i avoid it?
